description: Given an array of integers `temperatures` representing the daily temperatures, return an array `answer` such that `answer[i]` is the number of days you have to wait after the `i`th day to get a warmer temperature. If there is no future day for which this is possible, keep `answer[i] == 0` instead.

examples.explanation: Day 0 (73): next warmer is day 1 (74), wait 1. Day 1 (74): next warmer is day 2 (75), wait 1. Day 2 (75): next warmer is day 6 (76), wait 4. Day 3 (71): next warmer is day 5 (72), wait 2. Day 4 (69): next warmer is day 5 (72), wait 1. Day 5 (72): next warmer is day 6 (76), wait 1. Days 6 and 7 have no warmer future day.
Each day gets a warmer temperature the next day, except the last.
Each day gets a warmer temperature the next day, except the last.

testCases.explanation: Strictly increasing — each day waits exactly 1, last day has no warmer future.
Strictly decreasing — no day ever gets a warmer temperature.
Single element — no future days, result is [0].
All temperatures equal — never strictly warmer, so all zeros.
